result.execSummary:
The defendant Kolett Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kolett Walker

records.addlTxt: Received and filed

Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment 973.195:

"DENIED because it is not in the public interest.  The court finds that the full time designated for initial confinement at sentencing is necessary to punish and deter the defendant. Furthermore, it would unduly depreciate the seriousness of the offense if the defendant did not serve 100% of the confinement time as ordered by the court. Adjusting the confinement time would compromise the intent of the court and defeat the purpose of the sentence,
which was punishment, deterrence, and community protection. In addition, the number of conduct reports,
which includes a major violation in March of 2018, demonstrates that the defendant has not positively
adjusted her conduct and that she is not an appropriate candidate for sentence adjustment."

Order signed, filed and disbursed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Cynthia Davis, Branch 21, calendar successor, for review. spc

Count 6.  

(Return address: Kolett Walker #633995, REECC, 21425A Spring Street, Union Grove, WI  53182)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request to Restructure Sentence, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request to restructure sentence.
Letter to defendant regarding eligibility for substance abuse program.
Defendant's pro se request for eligibility for substance abuse program.
Original Transcript of GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING (43 pages) commencing 08/28/2015 received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Court has reviewed all submissions by state and defense.  Statements to the court.  Additional statement by Rachel Anderson, Initial assessment social worker.
Count 1:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 129 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.
Count 2:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 30 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 1.  CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 MONTHS.
Count 6:    The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 26 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, consecutive to count 2.  CONFINEMENT of 13 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 13 MONTHS with the following conditions as to each count:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-NO CONTACT with children without consent of children's court order or social worker.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit; Ineligible Voting; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

AS to counts 1, 2, 6 of the AMENDED Information:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the AMENDED Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
AS to counts 3,4,5,7-11 court orders counts dismissed and read in for sentencing.

Defendant Kolett Walker in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Kolett Walker in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed changing count 1 only: PHYSICAL ABUSE OF A CHILD(Reckless Causation of Bodily Harm), a class I felony, 948.03(3)(b)
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, Jury Instructions, seven letters on behalf of the defendant, and photo with cover letter.

Attorney Eric Richard Hart in court, defendant Kolett Walker not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense Motion to Modify Bail is heard and DENIED by the Court.  The Court ordered gps supervision as a condition of bail.  Upon the motion of the State, the Court amended the No Contact Order to include the current placement of children with paternal family members.  

Offer and discovery received by defense counsel.  Upon the request of defense counsel, to allow further investigation, case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 6-1-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kolett Walker in court with attorney Eric Richard Hart.  Defendant Kolett Walker in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.   Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 04.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MC dob 7/26/01; AW dob 3/5/03; TR dob 3/13/08 or HC dob 12/31/13
